summary: This is an email exchange between defense attorney Christian Everdell and an Assistant United States Attorney regarding the wording of a stipulation about a trial testimony transcript. The stipulation concerns a witness's testimony given on February 26, and the parties are negotiating the precise language to be used.

events.title: Stipulation Discussion
events.description: A conversation occurred between Christian Everdell and an Assistant United States Attorney regarding the wording of a stipulation about a trial testimony transcript.

events.title: Follow-up on Stipulation
events.description: Christian Everdell sends a follow-up email to the prosecutor asking if a revised version of the stipulation is acceptable.

events.title: Witness Trial Testimony
events.description: A witness gave trial testimony on this date. The subject of the correspondence is a stipulation to admit a transcript of this testimony.

keyFacts: The document is a 2021 email exchange between defense and prosecution attorneys negotiating legal language.
The subject is a stipulation to admit a 'true and accurate copy of the transcript of one witness's trial testimony' given on February 26.
The correspondence clarifies that the document in question is not the full trial transcript, but only one witness's testimony.
The defense team involved includes Christian Everdell, Bobbi C. Sternheim, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca.
